intro: Gouldia hillebrandii var. nodosa, commonly known as the nodose gouldia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, fragrant white to pink flowers that bloom in winter, adding ornamental value to gardens. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, providing year-round visual interest. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
